gw.api.search

Class NameFilter

  • java.lang.Object
    • gw.api.search.NameFilter

  • public class NameFilter
extends java.lang.Object
    An ordered list of NamePropertyValues that will filter all the values of a particular entity type. For example values for first and last name could be used to filter people, a value for name could be used to filter company/place and so on.

    The ordering of the property/value pairs is important because it determines the sort order of any sample results; the first property/value pair will be the primary ordering, the second will be the secondary and so on.

    This is trial API that may change or be replaced in future versions of ClaimCenter

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  NameFilter.PropertyValue
      A name property, that supports linguistic search, with an associated non empty string value

      Create a filter from the given property values, which must all refer to properties on the same type

    • Method Detail

      • forPerson

        public static NameFilter forPerson(java.lang.String firstName,
                                   java.lang.String lastName)
        Creates a new name filter for the person first and last name properties, with the given values. The filter is ordered with last name first.
        Parameters:
        firstName - a non null first name
        lastName - a non null last name
        Returns:
        a new name filter for the person first and last name properties, with the given values

      • getBoundedCount

        public int getBoundedCount(int bound)
        A bounded count of the number of items matching the name filter
        Parameters:
        bound - a non negative, non zero bound
        Returns:
        the number of items matching the name filter or bound if the number of matches is greater than or equal to the bound

      • getSample

        public NameSample getSample(int sampleSize)
        Create a NameSample object that represents a sample of the unique names that match this filter. The sample contains unique combinations of values that match this filter and is ordered according to the ordering of properties in the filter (first property is primary search, next is secondary and so on). The matching is done on the denormalized linguistic search values. For example in English the matching will be case insensitive.
        Parameters:
        sampleSize - the desired number of names in the sample
        Returns:
        a new NameSample object
